result.execSummary:
The defendant Deshawn D. Roscoe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with FLM.

No contact with DZ or SAR without approval by agent.

Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

Must complete an Anger Management Assessment and comply with all recommendations.

Must complete a Domestic Abuse Assessment and comply with all recommendations.

Must complete any other programming required by agent.

Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

$290.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

2:02 PM  Defendant Deshawn D. Roscoe in court, in custody. Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore in court for Deshawn D. Roscoe.  Attorney Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp in court for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. Counsel stipulates to 239 days credit. DA Kemp- argument. Recess. Back on. DA Kemp plays video. State requests court order 4 years IC, 4 years ES. Atty Larimore calls Tracy Dusek- S&T. Atty Larimore calls Nicholas Filkins- S&T. Atty Larimore calls Aliyah Izquirdo- S&T. Reads statement. Atty Larimore- argument. Requests probation be ordered and 1 year conditional jail. Exh 1- rec'vd. Defendant reads statement. 

SENTENCE: May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. Eligible for CIP and SA programs.
8 years WSP: 4 yrs WSP, 4 years IC. ES conditions: No contact with FLM. No contact with DZ or SAR without prior approval by agent. Complete an Anger Management assessment and comply with recommendations. Domestic Abuse assessment and comply with recommendations. $290.60 fine/costs, $250 DNA surcharge and sample. Any other programming required by agent. 239 days credit. PCR. 3:13 pm adj.
